body_html:
Hi,

I guess I understand what @panmari says because I have found the same problem.

There are no way to obtain the list of shadow variables, for example, for just save them.

After read the documentation, tf.moving_average_variables() seems to do the work. But it isn't because tf.moving_average_variables() returns the variables which moving average is applied not its shadow variables.

Thanks

body:
Hi,

I guess I understand what @panmari says because I have found the same problem.

There are no way to obtain the list of shadow variables, for example, for just save them.

After read the documentation, tf.moving_average_variables() seems to do the work. But it isn't because tf.moving_average_variables() returns the variables which moving average is applied not its shadow variables.

Thanks
